# Left shift assignment (<<=)

The **left shift assignment (`<<=`)** operator performs [left shift](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Left%5Fshift) on the two operands and assigns the result to the left operand.

## [Try it](#try%5Fit)

## [Syntax](#syntax)

```
x <<= y

```

## [Description](#description)

`x <<= y` is equivalent to `x = x << y`.

## [Examples](#examples)

### [Using left shift assignment](#using%5Fleft%5Fshift%5Fassignment)

```
let a = 5;
// 00000000000000000000000000000101

a <<= 2; // 20
// 00000000000000000000000000010100

let b = 5n;
b <<= 2n; // 20n

```
